channel.title: Comments on: Running your CFML code through Railo, OpenBD, and Adobe CF all at once
channel.description: Web development notes and commentary from Ryan Stille

item.title: By: Mike Henke
item.dc:creator: Mike Henke
item.description: Magic Junction is another tool for creating junctions.  The interface is nice and simple. http://www.rekenwonder.com/linkmagic.htm Works on a wide range of windows versions.
item.content:encoded: Magic Junction is another tool for creating junctions.  The interface is nice and simple. http://www.rekenwonder.com/linkmagic.htm Works on a wide range of windows versions.

item.title: By: scott conklin
item.dc:creator: scott conklin
item.description: Nice Posts and very interesting. i was wondering though if it were possible to take it a step further and make your hosts names , in your case railo.dev, openbd.dev, and cfusion.dev  all render content somehow outside of the context of one of the installed engines. (somehow having the shared subdir refer back to a different context root) i am still looking for away to do what you are doing, but have the docbase be wwwroot dir for example where i have all my projects.
item.content:encoded:
Nice Posts and very interesting. i was wondering though if it were possible to take it a step further and make your hosts names , in your case railo.dev, openbd.dev, and cfusion.dev  all render content somehow outside of the context of one of the installed engines. (somehow having the shared subdir refer back to a different context root)
i am still looking for away to do what you are doing, but have the docbase be wwwroot dir for example where i have all my projects.
